Sentencas: Gadolinia-doped ceria (GDC) is one of widely used electrolyte materials for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) due to its high ionic conductivity.
Titulo: Anisotropic mechanical behavior of gadolinia-doped ceria solid electrolytes under electromechanical coupling field using atomistic simulations

Sentencas: In this paper, we report the anisotropic mechanical behavior of GDC solid electrolytes under electromechanical coupling loading by molecular dynamics (MD) simulation.
Titulo: Anisotropic mechanical behavior of gadolinia-doped ceria solid electrolytes under electromechanical coupling field using atomistic simulations

Sentencas: For pure CeO2, it is found that low electric field merely reduces the fracture strength while high electric field directly changes phase transformation behavior in the [100] and [110] crystal orientations.
Titulo: Anisotropic mechanical behavior of gadolinia-doped ceria solid electrolytes under electromechanical coupling field using atomistic simulations

Sentencas: In the [111] crystal orientation, the increase of electric field lead to the synchronous elevation of fracture stress by weakening the electrostatic repulsion between adjacent oxygen ions.
Titulo: Anisotropic mechanical behavior of gadolinia-doped ceria solid electrolytes under electromechanical coupling field using atomistic simulations

Sentencas: And the doping concentration and temperature are considered to investigate the fracture behavior with electric field loading.
Titulo: Anisotropic mechanical behavior of gadolinia-doped ceria solid electrolytes under electromechanical coupling field using atomistic simulations

Sentencas: Moreover, significant improvement of electrolyte conductivity is obtained by loading electric field on GDC.
Titulo: Anisotropic mechanical behavior of gadolinia-doped ceria solid electrolytes under electromechanical coupling field using atomistic simulations

Sentencas: This finding might be able to provide a reasonable insight to reduce operating temperature of SOFC system.
Titulo: Anisotropic mechanical behavior of gadolinia-doped ceria solid electrolytes under electromechanical coupling field using atomistic simulations
